summary: This is a forwarded email from August 27, 2019, discussing the Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) withholding final autopsy reports for Jeffrey Epstein. The email states the OCME is delaying finalization to prevent the release of sensitive information, including video, guard names, and interviews, to Epstein's family and lawyers, and that the SDNY AUSA will coordinate redactions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose autopsy report is being discussed. The OCME is withholding the finalization of his reports.

events.title: Email regarding withholding of Epstein autopsy report
events.description: An email is sent stating the OCME will not finalize Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy reports to prevent sensitive information (video, guard names, interviews) from being released to his family and lawyers. The SDNY AUSA will work on redactions.

keyFacts: The Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) was deliberately withholding final autopsy reports for Jeffrey Epstein as of August 27, 2019.
The stated reason for withholding the reports was to prevent Epstein's family and lawyers from obtaining sensitive material, including video, guard names, and interviews.
The SDNY (Southern District of New York) assigned Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) was to work with the OCME to determine what information should be redacted before finalization.
